trans-unit.source: Provides access to the property values of a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern"></xref> object using its <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.Current"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.Cached"></xref> accessors.
Gets a value that specifies whether the value of a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element is read-only.

A control should have its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationElement.IsEnabledProperty> set to `true` and its <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.IsReadOnlyProperty> set to `false` before the client attempts a call to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern.SetValue%2A>.
`true` if the value is read-only; `false` if it can be modified.
Gets the value of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element.
Single-line edit controls support programmatic access to their contents through <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>.
However, multi-line edit controls do not support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern>control pattern.
To retrieve the textual contents of multi-line edit controls the controls must support the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>control pattern.
However, <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern> does not support setting the value of a control.
<xref:System.Windows.Automation.ValuePattern> does not support the retrieval of formatting information or substring values.
The <xref:System.Windows.Automation.TextPattern>control pattern must be used in these scenarios.
The value of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] element as a string.
The default is an empty string.
